  • Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms, deep learning architectures, and statistical methods
  • Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) and continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines
  • Ability to work in a collaborative environment and communicate effectively with cross-functional teams


bonus points for -

  • Knowledge of natural language processing (NLP) and its applications
  • Experience with MLOps tools and best practices for scalable model deployment and monitoring
  • Familiarity with data privacy and security regulations
  • Experience with real-time data processing and streaming technologies
  • Experience with reinforcement learning, generative models, or unsupervised learning techniques


Benefits

what you get -

  • Best in class salary: We hire only the best, and we pay accordingly
  • Proximity Talks: Meet other designers, engineers, and product geeks — and learn from experts in the field
  • Keep on learning with a world-class team: Work with the best in the field, challenge yourself constantly, and learn something new every day


About Us -

Proximity is the trusted technology, design, and consulting partner for some of the biggest Sports, Media and Entertainment companies in the world! We're headquartered in San Francisco and have offices in Palo Alto, Dubai, Mumbai, and Bangalore. Since 2019, Proximity has created and grown high-impact, scalable products used by 370 million daily users, with a total net worth of $45.7 billion among our client companies.

We are Proximity — a global team of coders, designers, product managers, geeks, and experts. We solve complex problems and build cutting edge tech, at scale. Our team of Proxonauts is growing quickly, which means your impact on the company's success will be huge. You'll have the chance to work with experienced leaders who have built and led multiple tech, product and design teams. Here's a quick guide to getting to know us better:

  • Watch our CEO, Hardik Jagda, tell you all about Proximity
  • Read about Proximity's values and meet some of our Proxonauts here
  • Explore our website, blog, and the design wing — Studio Proximity
  • Get behind-the-scenes with us on Instagram! Follow @ProxWrks and @H.Jagda

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Who we are

At CoverWallet we are determined to revolutionize the insurance industry! We launched in 2015 and since then we are the leading digital platform for contracting insurance for small and medium-sized companies. Thanks to state-of-the-art technology and meticulous design we have turned insurance management and processing into a simple, fast and convenient process for our clients. All online, in minutes!




Our passion is in delivering innovation and value creation through technology, and our mission is to become the world’s leading InsurTech. For this, we have built an incredible team of ~800 people based in New York, Spain, Poland and Singapore. Success is guaranteed as we are part of Aon, the global leaders in risk, retirement and health solutions with 50,000 colleagues worldwide. We combine the mindset and culture of a high-growth startup with the backing and support of a global multinational. The best of both worlds in one company - what more could we ask for?




What you will do

We are looking for a highly motivated and skilled Data Scientist to join our dynamic Data Science team. Our mission is to drive innovation and leverage machine learning and data-driven solutions to solve strategic business challenges. You will work across various domains, including product, sales, marketing, and operations, impacting business outcomes at scale. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, enjoys solving complex problems, and is passionate about learning and leveraging data science to create real-world impact.




A typical day

Develop predictive models, advanced analytics solutions, and visualization tools for internal teams and end customers. Initial projects may include: scoring models for sales and customer service, recommendation systems, automation of repetitive tasks to improve efficiency.
Conduct complex analyses for business stakeholders, translating insights into actionable recommendations.
Own the feedback loop for testing and improving machine learning models.
Design, propose, and measure A/B tests for product features, ensuring alignment with business goals.
Identify data-driven opportunities to enhance different stages of the customer journey.
Collaborate with data engineering and infrastructure teams to develop scalable, end-to-end solutions.
Serve as a technical representative when engaging with external stakeholders.
Recommend and implement new technologies, processes, and systems to optimize efficiencies and business performance.
Maintain awareness of emerging trends in data science, machine learning, and technology.
Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code.
Produce detailed technical documentation and presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences.




What you need to succeed

BSc/BA in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Physics, Engineering, or a related field.
Around 4 - 5 years of experience as a Data Scientist
Strong communication skills to translate technical analysis into business insights.
Extensive experience with Python and data visualization frameworks (e.g., Plotly, Seaborn, Matplotlib).
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Experience with data modeling and statistical analysis.
Familiarity with cloud environments (Google Cloud, AWS, etc.).
Experience with cloud infrastructure and deployment processes.
Solid understanding of clean code principles and version control (Git).
Knowledge of Docker and containerization technologies.
Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment.
Nice to have: Experience in designing and measuring A/B tests.
Nice to have: Knowledge of Large Language Models (LLMs) and their applications.
Nice to have: Knowledge of best practices around service-oriented architectures or microservices.




About the recruitment process

Your first contact with CoverWallet will be through an HR interview with one of our colleagues from the Talent Acquisition area, who will tell you everything about our company and its history, as well as the details of the position, functions and your future conditions. We would love to know your professional and academic career, and of course, your motivations and expectations for a new professional project. We will be happy to answer all your questions!
Do we have a match? Let’s move on to your First Technical Interview! You will meet two of the colleagues from the Data Science team, who will explain to you in more detail what the team's day-to-day life is and its responsibilities. They will be very interested in expanding information about your experience as a Data Scientist as well as your knowledge of our main technological environments.
If everything has gone well and you have impressed our colleagues... we advance to the second stage of the process! We will send you a data challenge based on a case study to find out your technical level and you will have a maximum of 7 days to complete it.
If you've made it this far, things are getting interesting... It's time for your Final Interview! In this case, you will have the opportunity to meet one of our Heads of Data and Engineering, who will close the selection process with an interview aimed at getting to know you not only on a professional and technical level, but also on a personal level, so that both of you can reach the conclusion of whether the purpose of our project fits with your professional aspirations.




Why CoverWallet

At CoverWallet you will have the opportunity to be a key player in the transformation of one of the largest industries and in one of the most developed digital markets in the world. You will work in a cutting-edge tech environment, alongside a super powerful and diverse global team. Join us and build your own career plan in one of the world's leading companies, tailored to your dreams and aspirations! And just for good measure…




💰 Competitive salary based on your background and experience, and a variable annual bonus set according to your goals
⏰ Enjoy flexible working hours and find out your ideal way of working thanks to our smart work model: full remote or hybrid, it’s up to you!
🎁 Perks package consisting of a Company-paid Life, Accident Insurance and Medical Cover with free dental care. Complement your benefits with our flexible compensation plan (tickets restaurant, transport card, daycare checks, external training and even a Pension Scheme!)
📚 Carry on with your training thanks to your additional budget of 1,500€ per year to finance training courses, certifications, books or any teaching aids that will help you continue to grow professionally
🛒 Enjoy a lot of offers and save on your purchases thanks to our discount platform (BigPocket) on your favorite brands (travel, fashion, technology, leisure...)
🏝 23 paid vacation days per year, plus 2 additional personal days and 2 wellbeing days to focus on your own health and prioritize self-care :)
🍏 Great offices in Madrid, Valencia and Sevilla. Come and enjoy all the activities we do, both inside and outside the office (hackathons, meetups, tech talks, code katas and much more!)

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Ready to find your perfect job fit?

Welcome to HomeBuddy, where making a home awesome is like seeing a vision come to life! We are on a mission to create a friendly and trusted platform to connect homeowners with the right contractors across the US.

What started as a small idea has become a fast-growing home improvement platform focusing on lead quality and long-term partnerships based on trust and mutual success. We are a product-first company with a long-term outlook - our platform consistently and positively evolves based on data insights and the most up-to-date tools.

This job is for you if


You would like to work in a positive atmosphere where teamwork and trust in your colleagues are primary values.
You succeed in an environment that values initiative and sharing feedback and where your suggestions and efforts are recognized and appreciated
You are used to taking responsibility for solving difficult tasks and are directly involved in how your efforts impact the final result



This role is full-time and offers home working flexibility.

Your future tasks will include


Developing and implementing machine learning models to refine lead scoring, identify customer segments, maximize conversions, optimize advertising bids, and prevent churn
Utilize geospatial and socioeconomic data to build predictive models that identify high-value audiences, leaving the competition in our dust
Design and implement pricing & distribution optimization algorithms that maximize lead conversion rates and minimize customer acquisition costs, ensuring we're always in the black
Collaborate seamlessly with marketing, sales, and product teams, translating data-driven insights into actionable campaigns
Present data findings with clarity, conciseness, and a dash of statistical humor, leaving stakeholders nodding in agreement



You're going to need this to be successful in this role


Master's Degree or PhD in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Econometrics, Quantitative Methods or a Related Field
5+ years of experience in the data domain with +2 in data science roles
Expertise in SQL, Python, and Machine Learning frameworks (especially supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms)
Proven experience deploying machine learning models to production environments using tools and frameworks like ML Flow & AWS Sagemaker, ensuring our models are always ready for prime time
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail
Impeccable communication and presentation skills, capable of translating data insights into actionable business strategies that drive revenue growth without losing the audience in a sea of jargon
A demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a cross-functional team, ensuring we're always scoring the highest in teamwork
Strong business acumen and the ability to translate data insights into actionable business strategies that drive revenue growth, making us a data-driven powerhouse
Fluent English



It's nice if you also have


Up-to-date with the latest data science techniques, whitepapers, and best practices
We value working on Kaggle projects, so if you have a passion for machine learning and are an active Kaggle contributor, please highlight this in your application



Why choose HomeBuddy


Enjoy the freedom to work from anywhere without being tied to one place - while ensuring you are available to our team during the agreed working hours
Achieve a harmonious work-life balance with a flexible schedule tailored to your local needs, along with paid vacation, sick leave, and local holidays
Empower yourself with work equipment of your choice partially paid for by HomeBuddy and up-to-date apps and tools to maximize your productivity
Feel valued and appreciated with an industry-leading compensation package
Get recognized and rewarded for both outstanding individual efforts leading to extraordinary results and our team success.
Enhance your well-being with our allowance program covering fitness activities and mental health programs
Learn and expand your knowledge by both working on complex tasks and using paid training opportunities, including courses, events, and conferences



If this sounds like you, we should talk!

Privacy Policy

By sending us your application you agree that Siren Group AG (known as HomeBuddy) will process your personal data to participate in this recruitment process. If you want to know more about how Siren Group AG processes your personal data please click here.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We're partnered with a VC-backed climate tech startup whose mission is to drive climate action through data. Their intelligent platform empowers organisations to tackle climate issues by monitoring their carbon footprint. It's currently being used by global sustainability leaders!




On the hunt for TWO talented Machine Learning Engineers with experience in Search, Recommendation Engines, and Text Classification to join our dynamic team. You'll collaborate with developers, scientists, and experts to improve AI features that are at the core of what we do. If you're someone who loves taking ownership of projects and working in a team, this could be a great fit for you!




What you’ll do:

Build, develop, and maintain ML models, NLP, and Information Retrieval systems that power carbon intelligence globally.
Deliver key data and insights through platforms that support major enterprises in their climate action efforts.
Experiment and optimize models (like transformers, classifiers, LLMs) to improve our product’s search and recommendation engine.
Keep our data pipelines in check, ensuring everything’s ready for modeling.
Deploy and manage models using AWS SageMaker, Flask, and Pydantic.




What you’ll need:

Extensive experience in Machine Learning, specifically with Search, Classification, and Information Retrieval.
Python experience, specifically working with data pipelines and REST APIs.
A self-starter who enjoys problem-solving and working independently.
Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate with remote teams.




What's in it for you?:

Genuinely making a positive impact on the planet
Salary €100K-120K
Benefits, including employee stock options
As a remote-first company, their team collaborates from locations across Europe.




If this is of interest to you, please apply now!

Show more

If you're someone who loves taking ownership of projects and working in a team, this could be a great fit for you!


What you’ll do:

  • Build, develop, and maintain ML models, NLP, and Information Retrieval systems that power carbon intelligence globally.
  • Deliver key data and insights through platforms that support major enterprises in their climate action efforts.
  • Experiment and optimize models (like transformers, classifiers, LLMs) to improve our product’s search and recommendation engine.
  • Keep our data pipelines in check, ensuring everything’s ready for modeling.
  • Deploy and manage models using AWS SageMaker, Flask, and Pydantic.


What you’ll need:

  • Extensive experience in Machine Learning, specifically with Search, Classification, and Information Retrieval.
  • Python experience, specifically working with data pipelines and REST APIs.
  • A self-starter who enjoys problem-solving and working independently.
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate with remote teams.


What's in it for you?:

  • Genuinely making a positive impact on the planet
  • Salary €100K-120K
  • Benefits, including employee stock options
  • As a remote-first company, their team collaborates from locations across Europe.


If this is of interest to you, please apply now!

Title: Data Scientist Senior - MLOps & Transformation (F/H)
Description:
Le groupe RENAULT s'engage résolument dans une nouvelle ère, propulsée par sa stratégie RENAULution, qui place la Data et l'Intelligence Artificielle au cœur de sa transformation.




Renault Digital, acteur clé de cette révolution depuis 2017, contribue activement à relever les défis de la mobilité de demain et à façonner l'industrie 4.0.




Rejoignez notre Centre d'Excellence IA (AI CoE), une équipe agile de 30 Data Scientists et Data Analysts, et participez à la conception, au développement et au déploiement à grande échelle de solutions Data et IA innovantes qui impacteront l'ensemble de nos activités.




Votre mission :

En tant que Data Scientist Senior, vous serez un acteur clé de la transformation des processus métier de Renault grâce à la puissance de la Data et de l'IA. Votre rôle consistera à :




Comprendre les enjeux métiers : Collaborer étroitement avec les équipes métier pour identifier les défis, les opportunités et les besoins en matière de Data et d'IA.
Concevoir et développer des solutions : Traduire les besoins métiers en problèmes de Data Science et concevoir des solutions innovantes et performantes, allant de la modélisation prédictive à l'optimisation des processus.
Déployer et industrialiser les modèles : Participer activement au déploiement des modèles en production en utilisant les enablers IA implémenté au sein du CoE, en mettant en œuvre les bonnes pratiques MLOps (automatisation, monitoring, gestion des versions...) pour garantir leur fiabilité, leur performance et leur scalabilité.
Contribuer à la création d’enablers techniques : Dans le cadre de nos activités de déploiement, collaborer à la création des outils techniques pour accélérer les processus de mise en production des solutions IA.
Communiquer et vulgariser : Présenter les résultats des analyses et des modèles de manière claire et concise aux équipes métier, en adaptant le discours au public cible et en mettant en évidence la valeur ajoutée des solutions.
Innover et partager les best practices : Se tenir informé des dernières avancées en Data Science / IA et en software engineering afin de contribuer à l'amélioration continue des pratiques et des outils au sein de l'équipe et du groupe Renault en général.
Être un ambassadeur de la Data : Promouvoir la culture Data et l'adoption de l'IA au sein de l'entreprise.




Profil recherché :

Diplôme d'ingénieur ou Master en Data Science, Statistiques, Mathématiques, Informatique ou domaine connexe.
Minimum 5 ans d'expérience en tant que Data Scientist, avec une expérience significative dans la conception, le développement et le déploiement de solutions Data et IA en environnement industriel ou sur le cloud.
Solide connaissance des algorithmes de Machine Learning et des techniques statistiques.
Maîtrise de Python et des principales librairies de Data Science (Scikit-learn, Pandas, NumPy, TensorFlow, PyTorch...).
Bonne connaissance des outils et des pratiques MLOps (CI/CD, conteneurs, Git, Kubernetes, Airflow...).
Familiarité avec les plateformes Cloud (GCP de préférence).
Excellentes compétences en communication et en vulgarisation.
Capacité à travailler en équipe et à collaborer avec des interlocuteurs de différents horizons.
Forte orientation business et capacité à comprendre les enjeux de l'entreprise.
Maîtrise de l'anglais (écrit et oral).




Les plus qui feront la différence :

Profil ayant travaillé sur de multiples sujets dans des environnements variés.
Expérience dans le secteur automobile ou dans un environnement industriel similaire.
Connaissance des enjeux de la mobilité de demain.
Certifications GCP et Dataiku.
Participation à des conférences ou des événements Data Science.




Informations complémentaires :

Poste basé à Boulogne-Billancourt (France) en CDI (temps plein)
Accord télétravail




Vous êtes prêt(e)s à relever avec nous les défis de la data, n’hésitez pas à postuler !!

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Our client holds a prominent position in the European utilities sector, dedicated to seamlessly connecting people with energy and providing customer-centric solutions designed for user convenience.


The company develops cloud-based state-of-the art software applications in different areas such as IoT, energy management, RPA & Machine Learning.


This role is available only in Romania and involves an employment contract.


Responsibilities:

  • Work with stakeholders to understand their needs;
  • Team up with data scientists, BA's and tech experts to develop and implement data & AI solutions;
  • Maintain high-quality data and code;
  • Stay updated on the latest trends in data science & AI;
  • Create AI models that can be reused to improve efficiency.


Skills and requirements

  • 4+ years of experience as a Data Scientist and a degree or relevant experience in Computer Science or a related field;
  • Coding skills and experience in building NLP models (Python);
  • Experience with handling large datasets;
  • Hands-on experience with ML tools (e.g. scikit-learn, XGBoost);
  • Develop scalable pipelines on Spark/Databricks;
  • Experience with end-to-end data pipelines;
  • Familiarity with Git and CI/CD workflows;
  • Experience with visualization tools such as Streamlit or PowerApps is considered an advantage.



To get a better idea of the project you could be a part of, start a discussion with our EDUROM consultant: just click "Easy Apply".


Your application will go to EDUROM Recruitment, part of the EDUROM Group. We acknowledge that moving on to a new job or challenge has a great impact on your professional, but also your personal life. And we believe you can make a great CAREER CHOICE, based on a WELL-INFORMED decision. Through honest discussions and relevant interviews, our HR consultants promise to assist you in this time period.

Title: data scientist
Company: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS
Description:
La Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS, World’s Best Hospital per il terzo anno consecutivo secondo la classifica Newsweek e unico italiano nella top 40 a livello mondiale.

La sua Mission è quella di affermarsi nelle seguenti aree di maggior rilievo:







Innovazione, Cura, Ricerca e Solidarietà







CHI CERCHIAMO?

La Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS è alla ricerca di persone con spirito d'iniziativa e capacità innovative, approccio alla multidisciplinarietà e al lavoro di gruppo, con voglia di intraprendere un percorso insieme nell’eccellenza professionale sanitaria in un contesto sfidante ed internazionale.

Sei pronto a metterti in gioco?

Stiamo ricercando:







JOB POSITION: Data Scientist Senior




ATTIVITA’ DEL RUOLO:




La risorsa si occuperà di:

Supporto per definizione di protocolli di estrazione e gestione dei dati clinici, omici, imaging, per modernizzare la piattaforma dati dell’IRCCS e garantire l’interoperabilità e condivisione dei dati
Elaborazione dati e immagini biomediche ed estrazione feature radiomiche
Sviluppo e validazione di modelli predittivi tramite tecniche di machine learning
Supporto scrittura protocolli e articoli scientifici







PROFILO DEL CANDIDATO:




Laurea magistrale in Ingegneria Biomedica/Informatica/Computer Science/Data Science
Dottorato di ricerca con focus su image analysis, machine learning
Conoscenza di analisi ed elaborazione di dati e bioimmagini, analisi radiomica
Esperienza nello sviluppo e validazione modelli predittivi di machine learning
Linguaggi programmazione python e R
Conoscenza dei principali pacchetti python per analisi dati e immagini
Saper lavorare in gruppi multidisciplinari
Software development engineering, analisi statistiche
Esperienza nella gestione del dato clinico e di imaging in studi multicentrici










COMPLETANO IL PROFILO:




Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese scritta e parlata
Ottime doti comunicative e di problem solving
Capacità di lavorare in team e per obiettivi
Analisi critica e proattività
Conduzione in autonomia del lavoro
Flessibilità e affidabilità
Scientific writing




TIPOLOGIA CONTRATTUALE OFFERTA:

Contratto a tempo determinato




DURATA DEL CONTRATTO:

5 mesi – sostituzione maternità




COSA TROVERAI




La Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS offre un’esperienza unica dal punto di vista umano e professionale, che consiste nel far parte di team che lavorano per obiettivi comuni sposando i valori dell’Etica e del Rispetto.

Un ambiente stimolante e sfidante che abbraccia il cambiamento in ogni sua forma
La possibilità di lavorare in modalità agile e flessibile all’interno di spazi di co-working nuovi e pensati per la collaborazione
Apprendimento continuo per lo sviluppo del sapere professionale, scientifico e tecnico attraverso percorsi formativi personalizzati
Una realtà che persegue obiettivi sostenibili allo scopo di salvaguardare il nostro pianeta e le nostre Persone
Una struttura che favorisce la Diversity ed Inclusion. Lavorerai in team con Persone di età diverse, culture diverse, storie diverse. Crediamo che la Diversità crei scambio di Idee e lo scambio di Idee crei Valore.
L’opportunità di accesso a percorsi di carriera nel rispetto dei principi di equità e valorizzazione del merito.




GLI INGREDIENTI CHE ACCOMUNANO LE NOSTRE PERSONE




La Passione per il cosa si fa: è ciò che muove tutti noi a lavorare quotidianamente con competenza e professionalità al fine di Migliorare la Vita di ognuno di Noi.

L’Impegno per l’Innovazione: in quanto centro di Ricerca accogliamo il cambiamento ed il progresso continuo.

La Responsabilità etica e sociale: ci dedichiamo costantemente a realizzare progettualità legate alla sostenibilità sociale, perché riteniamo che ognuno di noi può dare il proprio contributo lavorando con integrità, trasparenza ed onestà in tutte le azioni




SU DI NOI

La Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS si conferma come il luogo in cui competenze scientifiche e tecniche, sensibilità umana, etica e valori cattolici diventano un impegno concreto per cure eccellenti e accessibili all’intera comunità. Il valore che viene quotidianamente posto al centro dell’operare è, fin dalle origini, la cura della persona malata, nel rispetto integrale della sua dignità, dei suoi bisogni, della sua sofferenza e della sua speranza.

LO SAPEVI CHE?

Nel 2018 è stato riconosciuto il carattere scientifico del Policlinico Gemelli per le discipline di “Medicina Personalizzata” e di “Biotecnologie innovative”, diventando un Istituto di Ricovero e Cura a Carattere Scientifico (IRCCS)

Nel 2021 ha ottenuto l’accreditamento Joint Commission International (JCI)

Dal 2022 per il quinto anno consecutivo è stata conseguita la certificazione “Top Employer” nonché

la certificazione “Italy’s Best Employers 2024”.




VUOI UNIRTI A NOI?




I PROSSIMI STEPS




Il recruiting della Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS avviene tramite diversi canali in relazione alla tipologia di profilo ricercato con l’obiettivo di garantire la migliore candidate experience possibile.

Una volta scelta la posizione, basta seguire pochi e semplici passi per inoltrare la propria candidatura. Se in linea con il profilo, si avrà la possibilità di accedere ad un colloquio orale, motivazionale e tecnico.

Le candidature ricevute saranno considerate in base al match con la posizione ricercata, indipendentemente da nazionalità, origine etnica, genere, orientamento sessuale, età, religione etc..

Title: Biological Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

Syngenta Group, a global leader in agricultural technology and innovation, employs 60,000 people across more than 100 countries to transform agriculture through tailor-made solutions for farmers, society, and our planet. Our diverse portfolio encompasses seeds, crop protection, nutrition products, agronomic solutions, and digital services, all designed to help farmers produce healthy food, feed, fiber, and fuel while conserving natural resources and protecting the environment. Our mission is to address critical challenges such as climate change and food security through sustainable practices and cutting-edge solutions, while safeguarding the planet's resources.

Syngenta Seeds, a leading developer and producer of Field Crops, Vegetable, and Flower Seeds, is part of Syngenta Group. We bring farmers more vigorous, stronger, resistant plants, including innovative hybrid varieties and biotech crops.

Job Description


Type: Permanent
Business Unit: P&S – Vegetable Seed Enhancement Technology
Location: NL-Enkhuizen 


Responsibilities

The Vegetable Seed Enhancement Team (VSET) is closely connected to the vegetable seeds R&D, production and processing plants and services all Syngenta vegetable sites globally. We have an exciting opportunity for a highly motivated Biological Data Scientist to join us and be a member of a multidisciplinary team embedded with a variety of stakeholders to support the global vegetable seeds business. You will focus on designing and implementing imaging technologies, algorithms, and building artificial intelligence systems to automate measurements and understanding of seeds and plants. Key responsibilities will include:


Translating the imaging and AI systems to commercial scales that could be used across vegetable seed processing plants.
Designing and implementing automated seed processing systems using image-based methods and artificial intelligence.
Applying AI and machine learning techniques to study and analyse seed phenotypes and seedling characteristics.
Processing and interpreting large datasets to identify trends in seed quality and translating the findings to practical solutions to improve seed quality.
Collaborating with interdisciplinary teams to drive innovation in seed science and practical solutions beneficial to the global Syngenta VEG business.


Qualifications


Ph.D. or MSc degree with proven experience in machine learning and artificial intelligence or equivalent qualifications.
Strong knowledge of image analysis, machine learning, and seed physiology; or willingness to learn and establish strong knowledge of seed physiology and business.
Strong project management skills with the ability to lead projects in a corporate environment.
Ability to convey complex technical concepts to diverse audiences, while influencing and persuading key stakeholders.
Demonstrated ability to make data-driven decisions, while valuing and incorporating expert inputs when needed.
English language proficiency at minimum B2 level (Common European Framework scale) and willingness to learn Dutch.
Enjoys working in a highly diverse corporate environment with focus on innovation and customer centricity.


Additional Information

Take your chance!

At Syngenta, we believe in creating an inclusive and diverse work environment where all employees are valued and given the opportunity to grow. We offer a competitive salary and a comprehensive package of secondary employment benefits.

Are you excited to strengthen our team? Don't miss this great opportunity! Apply online today at www.syngenta.com. For questions, please contact our recruiter Nienke Terluin at Nienke.terluin@syngenta.com.

HTML:
Company Description

Syngenta Group, a global leader in agricultural technology and innovation, employs 60,000 people across more than 100 countries to transform agriculture through tailor-made solutions for farmers, society, and our planet. Our diverse portfolio encompasses seeds, crop protection, nutrition products, agronomic solutions, and digital services, all designed to help farmers produce healthy food, feed, fiber, and fuel while conserving natural resources and protecting the environment. Our mission is to address critical challenges such as climate change and food security through sustainable practices and cutting-edge solutions, while safeguarding the planet's resources.

Syngenta Seeds, a leading developer and producer of Field Crops, Vegetable, and Flower Seeds, is part of Syngenta Group. We bring farmers more vigorous, stronger, resistant plants, including innovative hybrid varieties and biotech crops.

Job Description

  • Type: Permanent
  • Business Unit: P&S – Vegetable Seed Enhancement Technology
  • Location: NL-Enkhuizen 

Responsibilities

The Vegetable Seed Enhancement Team (VSET) is closely connected to the vegetable seeds R&D, production and processing plants and services all Syngenta vegetable sites globally. We have an exciting opportunity for a highly motivated Biological Data Scientist to join us and be a member of a multidisciplinary team embedded with a variety of stakeholders to support the global vegetable seeds business. You will focus on designing and implementing imaging technologies, algorithms, and building artificial intelligence systems to automate measurements and understanding of seeds and plants. Key responsibilities will include:

  • Translating the imaging and AI systems to commercial scales that could be used across vegetable seed processing plants.
  • Designing and implementing automated seed processing systems using image-based methods and artificial intelligence.
  • Applying AI and machine learning techniques to study and analyse seed phenotypes and seedling characteristics.
  • Processing and interpreting large datasets to identify trends in seed quality and translating the findings to practical solutions to improve seed quality.
  • Collaborating with interdisciplinary teams to drive innovation in seed science and practical solutions beneficial to the global Syngenta VEG business.

Qualifications

  • Ph.D. or MSc degree with proven experience in machine learning and artificial intelligence or equivalent qualifications.
  • Strong knowledge of image analysis, machine learning, and seed physiology; or willingness to learn and establish strong knowledge of seed physiology and business.
  • Strong project management skills with the ability to lead projects in a corporate environment.
  • Ability to convey complex technical concepts to diverse audiences, while influencing and persuading key stakeholders.
  • Demonstrated ability to make data-driven decisions, while valuing and incorporating expert inputs when needed.
  • English language proficiency at minimum B2 level (Common European Framework scale) and willingness to learn Dutch.
  • Enjoys working in a highly diverse corporate environment with focus on innovation and customer centricity.

Additional Information

Take your chance!

At Syngenta, we believe in creating an inclusive and diverse work environment where all employees are valued and given the opportunity to grow. We offer a competitive salary and a comprehensive package of secondary employment benefits.

Are you excited to strengthen our team? Don't miss this great opportunity! Apply online today at www.syngenta.com. For questions, please contact our recruiter Nienke Terluin at Nienke.terluin@syngenta.com.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Apgar is looking to recruit a Junior Machine Learning Engineer who wants to join our growing team in Porto or Lisbon and be part of a group of +200 teammates who are passionate about data.




Some of the advantages of working with us..

· Flexible working schedule and ability to work in a hybrid mode (5 times in the office per month; 6 weeks a year fully remote from wherever you agree on)

· Competitive salary with benefits

· Be supported by a senior consultant (mentor) that will help in your career development

· A team spirit that will make you feel at home

· Be part of a team located in 3 different continents where diversity is as common as the air your breath




Your mission...

- Design and Implement Models: Develop, train, and fine-tune machine learning models to solve specific business problems.
- Data Preparation: J5Collect, clean, preprocess data, and perform feature engineering for training and testing models.
- Deployment and Maintenance: Deploy machine learning models into production environments and monitor their performance.
- Collaboration and Leadership: Work with data scientists, software engineers, and stakeholders, providing technical guidance and leadership.
- Software Development: Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code in Python, developing and maintaining software applications.
- Automation and Scripting: Create scripts to automate tasks and develop tools for data processing and analysis.
- Research and Innovation: Research and test advanced machine learning algorithms and techniques.




You have...

- Strong knowledge of machine learning algorithms and techniques such as Decision Trees, Gradien Boosting, Clustering, Outlier Detection, Time Series Forecasting.

- Strong experience in Python, SQL, and relevant python packages such as Pandas, Scikit-learn, Mathplotlib.

- Proven experience in developing and deploying machine learning models. Experience with MLflow or similar MlOps platfroms is a plus.

- Proven experience in managing data bases such as PostgreSql.

- Proven experienece in using version control systems such as Gitlab.

- Experience in implementing RAG solutions is a plus.

- Experience in implementing APIs in FastAPI or Flask is a plus.

- Experience in Azure Machine Learning, AWS Sagemaker, or Google Cloud machine learning services, PyTorch, or TensorFlow are a plus.

- Ability to clearly articulate ideas and technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

- Collaboration and Teamwork.

- Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically.

- A strong desire to continuously learn and stay updated with the latest advancements in machine learning.

- Fluent in English, with the ability to work on international projects.




Who we are…

Apgar is a leading company in the development and implementation of data platforms, recognized by analysts as one of the world leaders in this area.

We support our clients in their digital transformation, through the global team that has more than 200 consultants in our offices located in Europe (Portugal, UK, France, Switzerland, Cyprus), The Americas (USA and Brazil), Middle East (Lebanon) and South Asia and Oceania (Singapore and Australia).

Our consultants work on developing Master Data Management, Data Governance, Data Integration, Advanced Data Analytics and Machine Learning solutions among others.

Let's talk about your future in the world of data management software?




We firmly believe in an ethical approach to recruitment, where every candidate is treated with consideration, fairness, and transparency throughout the selection process, with the aim of respecting diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities.

Title: AI/ML Engineer – Genomic Data Analysis
Description:
The Role

We seek an innovative AI/ML engineer to develop foundation models for analyzing high-dimensional genomic data. You will design, optimize, and deploy large language models to extract insights from large datasets uniquely generated by our high throughput platform. No biology/genomics background is required. But you should be excited to reveal human biology at unprecedented resolution using AI.




What you will be working on

Develop and optimize AI/ML models for analyzing high-dimensional biological datasets.
Design training data generation and simulation algorithms to enhance measured datasets.
Train, validate, and fine-tune models for real-world applications.
Implement and manage end-to-end machine learning pipelines.
Address scalability, model efficiency, and computational challenges.
Innovate AI architectures to improve accuracy and interpretability.
Collaborate with bioinformaticians, data scientists, and engineers.
Stay at the cutting edge of AI/ML advancements.




What you should know or have

PhD, MS, or BS in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or related field.
Proficiency in Python and ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Strong understanding of large language models and deep learning.
Creative problem-solving and ability to work in multidisciplinary teams.




Our Opportunity

Sampling Human is introducing single-cell and spatial sequencing solutions for clinical applications. We’re revealing a new layer of biological information that enables earlier, more precise insights and drives longer, healthier lives. Our products combine genomic measurements with AI-generated biology in end-to-end data pipelines that redefine what’s measurable at scale.

We’re a small, well-funded, mission-driven team of molecular and cell biologists, software and automation engineers, mathematicians, computer scientists, and business professionals, all building at the convergence of computation and biology. At Sampling Human, you’ll do foundational work, chase ambitious ideas, and deliver products that directly impact health. You’ll also get access to a cutting-edge tech stack and proprietary datasets that uncover the most interesting cells in the human body at scale.

If you want to build human informatics from the ground up, you are in the right place.

Title: Data Scientist - QuantumBlack, AI by McKinsey
Description:
Who You'll Work With

Only at McKinsey

Work on real-world, high-impact projects across a variety of industries – Identify micro patterns in data that our clients can exploit to maintain their competitive advantage and watch your technical solutions transform their day-to-day business.

Experience the best environment to grow as a technologist and a leader – Develop a sought-after perspective connecting technology and business value by working on real-life problems across a variety of industries and technical challenges to serve our clients on their changing needs.

Be surrounded by inspiring individuals as part of diverse multidisciplinary teams - Develop a holistic perspective of AI by partnering with the best design, technical, and business talent in the world as your team members.

Our Tech Stack

While we advocate for using the right tech for the right task, we often leverage the following technologies Python, PySpark, the PyData stack, SQL, Airflow, Databricks, our own open-source data pipelining framework called Kedro, Dask/RAPIDS, container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes, cloud solutions such as AWS, GCP, and Azure, and more.

Your Impact

You will work with other data scientists, data engineers, machine learning engineers, designers and project managers on interdisciplinary projects, using math, stats and machine learning to derive structure and knowledge from raw data across various industry sectors.

You will be a highly collaborative individual who is capable of laying aside your own agenda, listening to and learning from colleagues, challenging thoughtfully and prioritizing impact. You search for ways to improve things and work collaboratively with colleagues. You believe in iterative change, experimenting with new approaches, learning and improving to move forward quickly. 

As a Data Scientist, you’ll


Partner with our clients, from data owners and users to C-level executives, to understand their needs and build impactful analytics solutions.
Contribute to cross-functional problem-solving sessions with your team and deliver presentations to colleagues and client.
Translate business problems into analytical problems and develop models aimed at solving our clients and users problems and ensure they are evaluated with the relevant metrics.
Write highly optimized code to advance our internal Data Science Toolbox.
Add real-world impact to your academic expertise, as you are encouraged to write papers and present at meetings and conferences should you wish.
You will take part in R&D projects; attend conferences such as NIPS and ICML as well as data science retrospectives where you will have the opportunity to share and learn from your co-workers; work in one of the most advanced data science teams globally.
Work on the frameworks and libraries that our teams of data scientists and data engineers use to progress from data to impact; you will guide global companies through data science solutions to transform their businesses and enhance performance across industries including healthcare, automotive, energy and elite sport. 


Your Qualifications and Skills


Bachelor's, master's or PhD level in a discipline such as computer science, machine learning, applied statistics, mathematics, engineering or artificial intelligence
0-2 years of professional experience in applying machine learning and data mining techniques to real problems with copious amounts of data
Programming experience (focus on machine learning) R and/or Python (must), SPSS, SAS, Ruby, Hadoop (valued)
Ability to prototype statistical analysis and modeling algorithms and apply these algorithms for data driven solutions to problems in new domains
Ability to independently own and drive model development, balancing demands and deadlines
Demonstrated aptitude for analytics
Good presentation and communication skills, with the ability to explain complex analytical concepts to people from other fields
Willingness to travel

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Senior Data Scientist (NLP/Gen AI/CNN Specialist) – Remote/ Hybrid




Are you a Data Scientist with deep expertise in NLP, Generative AI, and CNNs? Do you thrive on building models from scratch and solving complex, real-world problems?




The Role

My client looking for innovative Senior Data Scientists to join their team and drive cutting-edge AI/ML solutions. You’ll work on training, fine-tuning, and deploying models—from foundational architectures to production-ready systems—with a focus on Natural Language Processing (NLP), Generative AI, and Computer Vision (CNN).




Key Responsibilities:

Develop, train, and optimize NLP models (LLMs, transformers, embeddings) and Generative AI solutions
Design and implement CNN-based computer vision models for complex datasets
Build end-to-end ML pipelines—from data preprocessing to model deployment
Apply deep learning techniques to solve business challenges at scale
Collaborate with engineering and product teams to productionize models
Stay ahead of emerging AI trends (diffusion models, RLHF, multimodal AI)




Required Skills:

Strong foundation in ML/DL: Experience training models from scratch (PyTorch/TensorFlow)
NLP Expertise: Hands-on with LLMs, transformers, text generation, embeddings, RAG
Generative AI: Fine-tuning, prompt engineering, or developing diffusion/VAE/GAN models
Programming: Python (PySpark, Scikit-learn), SQL, cloud platforms (Azure, Databricks, Snowflake)
Data Engineering: Big data processing, ETL pipelines, and optimization
Problem-solving: Ability to translate business needs into ML solutions




Preferred Qualifications:

MSc/PhD in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or related field
Experience with healthcare, temporal data, or high-stakes ML applications
Published research or open-source contributions in AI/ML
Familiarity with MLOps, model deployment (Docker, Kubernetes), and scalable AI systems

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist , Leusden




Natuurlijk is Data Science een essentieel onderdeel van onze Digital Transformation doelstellingen.

En die zijn ambitieus. Want om de nummer 1 te blijven in de Do It Yourself-markt, moeten we data slim inzetten om innovatief en efficiënt te blijven.

Onze organisatie groeit, en met de toenemende focus op data-gedreven werken, zijn we op zoek naar een ervaren Data Scientist die ons gedreven team komt versterken. Heb jij de technische expertise, strategisch inzicht en leiderschapskwaliteiten om data science binnen Intergamma naar het volgende niveau te brengen? Dan zijn we op zoek naar jou!




Over de functie:

De afgelopen twee jaar hebben we als team al mooie stappen gezet in de richting van data-driven innovatie. We hebben de eerste producten opgeleverd en geanalyseerd. Nu staan we als team klaar om deze successen verder te optimaliseren en door te ontwikkelen. Als Data Scientist werk je aan het bouwen en optimaliseren van machine learning-modellen en datapipelines die direct bijdragen aan deze doelen. Je speelt een sleutelrol in het realiseren van de roadmap, met de focus op het vertalen van data naar concrete inzichten die onze bedrijfsdoelen ondersteunen.




Je bent onder meer verantwoordelijk voor:

Het vergelijken van prestaties van verschillende bouwmarkten om best practices te identificeren en processen te verbeteren.
Het analyseren van klantdata en productcombinaties om datagestuurde beslissingen te nemen die de klantbeleving verbeteren.
Het ontwikkelen van voorspellende modellen voor klantwaarde om klanttevredenheid en -loyaliteit te verhogen.
Het ontwikkelen en implementeren van geavanceerde machine learning-modellen en deep learning-oplossingen die bijdragen aan de bedrijfsdoelstellingen.
Het bouwen en optimaliseren van complexe datapipelines en -architecturen.
Het vertalen van complexe business vraagstukken naar creatieve data science-oplossingen.
Het leiden van uitdagende projecten zoals het ontwikkelen van voorspellende modellen voor voorraadbeheer, het optimaliseren van prijsstrategieën, en het personaliseren van klantreizen door middel van machine learning.
Het motiveren en coachen van ons data science-team en het bieden van mentorship aan junior teamleden.
Het zichtbaar maken van data science binnen en buiten de organisatie door deel te nemen aan communities, het geven van presentaties, en het delen van kennis over markttrends.
Nauw samenwerken met teams zoals Marketing, Supply Chain en IT om cross-functionele data-oplossingen te ontwikkelen die onze bedrijfsprocessen optimaliseren.




Wat breng je mee:

Technische vaardigheden:
Diepe kennis van machine learning-algoritmen, deep learning, en geavanceerde data-analysetechnieken.
Ervaring met cloudplatforms zoals AWS, Azure, of GCP.
Beheersing van programmeertalen zoals Python, R, en SQL.
Ervaring met MLOps-tools en frameworks zoals TensorFlow, PyTorch of MLflow is een sterke pré.
Ervaring met relevante tools als Dataiku of Databricks
Business vaardigheden:
Uitstekende communicatievaardigheden in het Nederlands, om complexe analyses helder over te brengen aan diverse stakeholders.
Ervaring in het ontwikkelen van data-oplossingen die direct bijdragen aan bedrijfsresultaten.
Leiderschapskwaliteiten:
Vermogen om een team te inspireren, motiveren en naar een hoger niveau te tillen.
Ervaring met het beheren van data science-projecten en stakeholdermanagement.




Wat wij bieden:

Een bruto fulltime maandsalaris van € 3.800,- tot € 6.000,- (Intergamma betaalt per periode van 4 weken), inschaling is afhankelijk van ervaring.
Telefoon en laptop van de zaak, een goede pensioenregeling, en 32 vakantiedagen.
Flexibele werktijden en de mogelijkheid om deels thuis te werken.
Een dynamische werkomgeving bij een marktleider die ontwikkeling, werkplezier en welzijn centraal stelt.
Ruime mogelijkheden voor innovatie, diversiteit en persoonlijke groei.
Een unieke kans om impact te maken in een groeiende en innovatieve organisatie.




Achter elke klus vind je Intergamma:

Intergamma is dé organisatie achter de doe-het-zelf-formules GAMMA en Karwei. Met bijna 160 eigen bouwmarkten in Nederland en België zijn we al jaren de onbetwiste nummer één duurzame retailer op de doe-het-zelfmarkt. In Europa horen we bij de 15 grootsten. En daar zijn we trots op!

Vanuit ons hoofdkantoor in Leusden werken we met bijna 400 betrokken medewerkers samen om onze goede naam als omnichannel doe-het-zelf retailer hoog te houden. Dat doen we door volop te blijven investeren in verbeteringen en strategische initiatieven die ons verder de toekomst in helpen om gezond en winstgevend te blijven.




Sla nu de spijker op z’n kop!

Eerst nog vragen? Bel dan met Kido Otten op 06 83455440. Gelijk solliciteren kan ook via bijgaande sollicitatieknop.

Show more
HTML:
Data Scientist , Leusden


Natuurlijk is Data Science een essentieel onderdeel van onze Digital Transformation doelstellingen.

En die zijn ambitieus. Want om de nummer 1 te blijven in de Do It Yourself-markt, moeten we data slim inzetten om innovatief en efficiënt te blijven.

Onze organisatie groeit, en met de toenemende focus op data-gedreven werken, zijn we op zoek naar een ervaren Data Scientist die ons gedreven team komt versterken. Heb jij de technische expertise, strategisch inzicht en leiderschapskwaliteiten om data science binnen Intergamma naar het volgende niveau te brengen? Dan zijn we op zoek naar jou!


Over de functie:

De afgelopen twee jaar hebben we als team al mooie stappen gezet in de richting van data-driven innovatie. We hebben de eerste producten opgeleverd en geanalyseerd. Nu staan we als team klaar om deze successen verder te optimaliseren en door te ontwikkelen. Als Data Scientist werk je aan het bouwen en optimaliseren van machine learning-modellen en datapipelines die direct bijdragen aan deze doelen. Je speelt een sleutelrol in het realiseren van de roadmap, met de focus op het vertalen van data naar concrete inzichten die onze bedrijfsdoelen ondersteunen.


Je bent onder meer verantwoordelijk voor:

  • Het vergelijken van prestaties van verschillende bouwmarkten om best practices te identificeren en processen te verbeteren.
  • Het analyseren van klantdata en productcombinaties om datagestuurde beslissingen te nemen die de klantbeleving verbeteren.
  • Het ontwikkelen van voorspellende modellen voor klantwaarde om klanttevredenheid en -loyaliteit te verhogen.
  • Het ontwikkelen en implementeren van geavanceerde machine learning-modellen en deep learning-oplossingen die bijdragen aan de bedrijfsdoelstellingen.
  • Het bouwen en optimaliseren van complexe datapipelines en -architecturen.
  • Het vertalen van complexe business vraagstukken naar creatieve data science-oplossingen.
  • Het leiden van uitdagende projecten zoals het ontwikkelen van voorspellende modellen voor voorraadbeheer, het optimaliseren van prijsstrategieën, en het personaliseren van klantreizen door middel van machine learning.
  • Het motiveren en coachen van ons data science-team en het bieden van mentorship aan junior teamleden.
  • Het zichtbaar maken van data science binnen en buiten de organisatie door deel te nemen aan communities, het geven van presentaties, en het delen van kennis over markttrends.
  • Nauw samenwerken met teams zoals Marketing, Supply Chain en IT om cross-functionele data-oplossingen te ontwikkelen die onze bedrijfsprocessen optimaliseren.


Wat breng je mee:

  • Technische vaardigheden:
  • Diepe kennis van machine learning-algoritmen, deep learning, en geavanceerde data-analysetechnieken.
  • Ervaring met cloudplatforms zoals AWS, Azure, of GCP.
  • Beheersing van programmeertalen zoals Python, R, en SQL.
  • Ervaring met MLOps-tools en frameworks zoals TensorFlow, PyTorch of MLflow is een sterke pré.
  • Ervaring met relevante tools als Dataiku of Databricks
  • Business vaardigheden:
  • Uitstekende communicatievaardigheden in het Nederlands, om complexe analyses helder over te brengen aan diverse stakeholders.
  • Ervaring in het ontwikkelen van data-oplossingen die direct bijdragen aan bedrijfsresultaten.
  • Leiderschapskwaliteiten:
  • Vermogen om een team te inspireren, motiveren en naar een hoger niveau te tillen.
  • Ervaring met het beheren van data science-projecten en stakeholdermanagement.


Wat wij bieden:

  • Een bruto fulltime maandsalaris van € 3.800,- tot € 6.000,- (Intergamma betaalt per periode van 4 weken), inschaling is afhankelijk van ervaring.
  • Telefoon en laptop van de zaak, een goede pensioenregeling, en 32 vakantiedagen.
  • Flexibele werktijden en de mogelijkheid om deels thuis te werken.
  • Een dynamische werkomgeving bij een marktleider die ontwikkeling, werkplezier en welzijn centraal stelt.
  • Ruime mogelijkheden voor innovatie, diversiteit en persoonlijke groei.
  • Een unieke kans om impact te maken in een groeiende en innovatieve organisatie.


Achter elke klus vind je Intergamma:

Intergamma is dé organisatie achter de doe-het-zelf-formules GAMMA en Karwei. Met bijna 160 eigen bouwmarkten in Nederland en België zijn we al jaren de onbetwiste nummer één duurzame retailer op de doe-het-zelfmarkt. In Europa horen we bij de 15 grootsten. En daar zijn we trots op!

Vanuit ons hoofdkantoor in Leusden werken we met bijna 400 betrokken medewerkers samen om onze goede naam als omnichannel doe-het-zelf retailer hoog te houden. Dat doen we door volop te blijven investeren in verbeteringen en strategische initiatieven die ons verder de toekomst in helpen om gezond en winstgevend te blijven.


Sla nu de spijker op z’n kop!

Eerst nog vragen? Bel dan met Kido Otten op 06 83455440. Gelijk solliciteren kan ook via bijgaande sollicitatieknop.

Title: Data Scientist - Life Sciences
Description:
About Us:

Founded in 2003, BIP has established itself as a global leader in consulting, excelling particularly in Digital Transformation. With over 6000+ professionals, our expertise spans across various industries, enabling businesses to navigate and thrive in the digital age.




BIP Life Sciences brings together a global team of experts with deep industry and technical knowledge in pharma, biotech, med tech, and healthcare. We partner with the top 20 life science companies, leveraging our Centres of Excellence to deliver unmatched expertise in technology, data, people, and innovation.




BIP xTech is a global team dedicated to leveraging exponential technologies to provide comprehensive digital solutions and data-driven transformations. Utilizing advanced analytics and AI technologies, we provide end-to-end project execution from strategy to implementation.

At BIP, we are committed to excellence, ethical conduct, and fostering a culture where people can grow through diverse skills integration. We support smart working policies, promote work-life integration, and are dedicated to diversity, equity, and inclusion, ensuring equal opportunities for all. Our core values of trust, collaboration, entrepreneurship, courage, meritocracy, and development drive our team’s growth, making BIP a place where innovation thrives, and merit is rewarded.




Job Description:

We are seeking a highly skilled Data Scientist specializing in Life Sciences to join our dynamic team. This role involves leveraging advanced data analytics to drive insights and solutions for clients in the pharma, biotech, medtech, and healthcare sectors. You will work in engaging projects, collaborate with multidisciplinary teams, and act as a technical contributor and mentor. Your responsibilities include developing and implementing AI and Machine Learning solutions, enhancing decision-making processes, and improving operational efficiency. Additionally, you will support business development through pre-sales initiatives, research, and the development of new services and products, while also participating in conferences, publishing articles, and fostering a continuous learning environment. Join us to drive technological innovation and create value in the Life Sciences industry.




Key Responsibilities:

Execute data science projects in the life sciences domain, from data collection and processing to model development and deployment.
Collaborate with clients and multidisciplinary teams to drive technological innovation.
Provide technical expertise in presales activities, including developing proof-of-concepts and presenting data science capabilities to potential clients.
Design and implement advanced analytical applications for health and biomedical data analysis.
Stay updated with the latest advancements in data science and life sciences to apply cutting-edge techniques.
Mentor junior data scientists and provide technical guidance to the team.
Promote best practices and ensure project quality.




Qualifications:

PhD or Master’s degree in Data Science, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Computer Engineering, Mathematical Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, or related STEM disciplines.
Minimum of 3 years of experience in data science, with a focus on the life sciences industry
Experience with healthcare data standards and terminologies
Strong knowledge of machine learning algorithms, statistical methods, and data mining techniques
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, SQL.
Knowledge of cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Experience in presales or client-facing roles.
Fluent in professional English.




Nice to Have:

Experience with real-world evidence generation and observational research.
Knowledge of advanced NLP techniques and unstructured data analysis, including Generative AI.
Publications or contributions to the data science community.
Experience using Cloud services and APIs (GCP, Microsoft, AWS).
Experience with AGILE methodologies (Scrum, Kanban).




Soft Skills:

Strong communication and presentation skills.
Ability to translate complex technical concepts into clear and actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders.
Excellent organizational and time management skills.
Collaborative mindset with a proactive approach to problem-solving.
Adaptability and willingness to learn new technologies and methodologies.
Customer orientation, goal achievement, and strong problem-solving ability.
Precision and stress tolerance in meeting deadlines.
Availability for travel in Portugal and abroad.




Next Steps: Once we receive your CV, we will take the time to review it thoroughly. If there is a match with this or other open positions within the Group, we will contact you to start getting to know each other better.

Title: Data Scientist Junior- EY wavespace Data & AI hub
Description:
EY wavespace is creating innovative AI technology and products that will transform EY and our clients. The successful candidate will be part of a team building innovative AI solutions that rely on AI and ML techniques including but not limited to natural language processing, computer vision, deep learning, and machine learning.

You will work with:


Explore and try out exciting upcoming libraries, models, technologies to analyze and recommend the best one for the team
Design and implement scalable ML and DL systems, products, and solutions.
Collaborate with engineering and DevOps teams to build and deliver systems that can be deployed both in the cloud and on premise, e.g., using Azure, Docker, and Kubernetes.
Build deep learning-based products on CPUs and GPUs, leveraging latest deep learning and machine learning libraries.
Develop and evaluate data analytics models, algorithms, systems and solutions using a variety of advanced data science techniques
Produces complex predictive models and manages the delivery of solutions which can be used to drive measurable client and commercial benefit
Develops a solid understanding of data structures and business in order to extract and integrate required data sources for analysis


Key Requirements


Excellent programming skills: Experience in languages such as Python
1-2 years of relevant experience
You have experience with both machine learning and building software
You have experience with databases
Machine learning domain knowledge—bias-variance tradeoff, exploration/exploitation—and understanding of various model families, including neural net, decision trees, Bayesian models, instance-based learning, association learning, and deep learning algorithms
Good understanding in Deep Learning
Familiarity with Azure cloud ecosystem and OpenAI models
Experience working with large data sets
Excellent problem-solving skills
Strong communication and teamwork
Familiarity with Financial Services
Proficiency in English


Our commitment to diversity & inclusion

We are genuinely passionate about inclusion and we support individuals of all groups; we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, or disability status.

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
At Exacaster we impact the lives of over 40 million consumers on a daily basis by working with clients in the Baltics, USA, Central and South America and the Caribbean. Overall, we operate one of the largest big-data environments in the Baltics, and we certainly have one of the most diverse sets of data and pursue some of the most challenging analytical projects.

Exacaster’s team is looking for a Junior Data Scientist to join our Genesis team.

About the role:

We are seeking a Junior Data Scientist passionate about working with both generative AI and traditional ML solutions to solve business problems. This role involves assisting when designing, developing, and implementing business processes built on top of AI/ML models. These processes may encompass both back-end and front-end development, with a primary focus on Large Language Models (LLMs).

Who should apply:

This role is for a Junior Data Scientist who is passionate about and eager to learn both Generative AI and traditional data science. We encourage you to apply—even if your experience doesn’t perfectly align with our listed requirements. We value passion, curiosity, and a strong motivation to grow in this evolving field.

Your daily tasks will include:


Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to analyse Generative AI project requirements.
Develop data processes and solutions based on Generative AI models.
Develop and maintain knowledge bases using vector embeddings.
Optimise existing Generative AI processes and models for improved performance, scalability, and efficiency.
Create clear and concise documentation — including technical specifications, user guides, and presentations — to communicate complex Gen AI concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Research to stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in Generative AI and machine learning in general.



We are looking for a person who has:


Experience in the Data Science field: Knowledge of data analysis, statistical modeling, and machine learning (ML) techniques.
Interest in developing and implementing processes based on generative AI models, with hands-on experience with Large Language Models (LLMs) such as GPT-4o, Claude 3.5 Sonnet, and similar.
Proficiency in Python, with experience using GenAI and machine learning libraries and frameworks such as LangChain, LangServe, Streamlit, Chainlit, and others.
Knowledge of data structures and algorithms.
Interest in working with vector databases and vector search capabilities, such as Pinecone, Azure AI Search, and vector search extensions in relational databases like Amazon Aurora, Amazon RDS, etc.
Problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and creatively to develop innovative AI solutions.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex technical concepts to a diverse audience.
A proactive mindset, with the ability to work in dynamic environment on several concurrent projects.



Nice to have things:


Demonstrated interest in Research and Development (R&D): A passion for exploring cutting-edge technologies and contributing to innovative projects.
Experience with RESTful APIs.
Familiarity with cloud-based platforms and services, such as AWS, Azure, and/or GCP
Proficiency with Git for version control: Experience in collaborative development using Git, GitHub, or similar platforms.
Innovative mindset: Creative thinker with the ability to develop and implement novel AI solutions.



We promise:


Monthly salary for this position from 2627 Eur gross to 3284 Eur gross for a full time role.
Participation in the company’s stock options program.
Flexible Benefits & Personal learning budget.
10 Growth Days per year - dedicated time for learning and development.
Ownership and dynamics in your role.
Hybrid work environment with preferably at least 1 day per week in the office.
Mindletic – the app for your mental & emotional health.
All the support you need from our experienced team to become an even better professional.
And the most important thing – you will be part of a great international team!
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Gostamos de resolver problemas e não passamos um dia sem procurar soluções inovadoras. A Ytech é uma start-up tecnológica focada nos setores de IT e Telecomunicações que atua em duas principais áreas: desenvolvimento de projetos nacionais e projetos internacionais remotos.


🚀 Ready to join us, Data Scientist?


Tens as skills?

  • Experiência mínima de 5 anos;
  • Experiência em linguagens Python, R, SQL, processos ETL e tecnologias de Big Data;
  • Proficiência em Machine Learning;
  • Experiência em Power BI e SSRS;
  • Proficiência em extração de dados via API's;


O que nos torna diferentes

• A nossa visão consiste em inovar e reinventar através de serviços tecnológicos, promovendo o sucesso dos nossos parceiros.

• A nossa missão é conectar clientes a profissionais altamente especializados e impulsionar negócios.

• A nossa cultura é centrada nas pessoas e no seu bem-estar, o que nos permite atrair e reter o melhor de talento.


Junta-te à equipa Ytech! Envia o teu CV para abaiao@ytech.io

Title: Applied AI/ML Engineer
Description:
About Us

How did Web Summit become, in the words of Forbes, “the best tech conference on the planet”? Meaningful connections. Our tech events are unmissable because we make it easier for the right people to meet and connect. Everyone at Web Summit works towards this goal.

And we’re just getting started.

We’re always looking to build on the impact we have already made at Web Summit. In the coming years we’ll take Web Summit to new markets, promoting global connectivity, highlighting important issues and connecting global leaders – all while making a positive impact on the environment and communities we encounter.

To build a better company, we have to better ourselves. We do that by finding the most ambitious people to work with us.

We are seeking a versatile and innovative Applied AI/ML Engineer to lead the integration of Generative AI and machine learning into our product suite. This role is ideal for professionals who excel at transforming cutting-edge AI research into robust, user-centric applications.

Web Summits engineering team build in house software that powers all aspect of our attendees event experience, from native mobile applications, recommendation systems, and registration/tracking software to name a few.

What You Will Achieve


Design, develop, and deploy scalable machine learning models, with a focus on Generative AI applications such as LLMs, diffusion models, and transformers.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams—including product managers, data scientists, and software engineers—to integrate AI solutions seamlessly into products.
Implement and optimize data pipelines for training and inference processes.
Conduct rigorous testing and validation of models to ensure performance, reliability, and fairness.
Stay abreast of the latest advancements in AI/ML to inform technology choices and innovation strategies.


Skills And Abilities We Are Looking For


Proven experience in machine learning engineering, with a portfolio of deployed AI solutions.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, and familiarity with ML frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Strong understanding of data structures, algorithms, and software architecture.
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) and containerization tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.


Nice To Haves


Advanced degree (Master's or Ph.D.) in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field a plus but not essential.
Experience with prompt engineering and fine-tuning of large language models.
Familiarity with MLOps practices and tools for continuous integration and deployment of ML models.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.


Benefits And Perks


Hybrid-working model open to all employees.
Fully subsidised healthcare, dental, employee assistance programme (EAP) and more.
Pension contribution up to 6%(Irish based only)
A dedicated in-house L&D department, with access to workshops, online learning and resources to help you excel in your career development.
Company laptop, generous annual leave and flexible working arrangements.
Our very own Tramway Team, which drives community and morale-boosting events for employees to participate in.
Annual company get-togethers, charity days, and monthly wellbeing talks.
Wellness subsidy issued to all employees of €1000 per year


At Web Summit, we embrace diversity and inclusion. We want talent from all walks of life to help us on our journey to digitise the conference sector. Hiring decisions are made purely on experience, skills and the needs of the business.
Show more
